Description:
Quirky and iconic, Noah Ark is set in the heart of the Aberdare National Park, in Nyeri. The lodge overlooks a watering hole and salt lick, attracting a variety of wildlife, and features four viewing areas, including a ground-level bunker.

Description:
HotelDescription#The lodge provides a spectacular views of the majestic Kilimanjaro mountain. It is situated amidst lush tropical gardens and a tranquil pond. The lodge is a veritable oasis in the dramatic surroundings of Amboseli National Park. Walking the lodge grounds is a great experience with the discovery of various bird species, and the vervet monkeys and baboons that appear at certain times.

The hotel provides 83 rooms in total. Guests are welcomed in a lobby. A bar, restaurant and conference facilities are also available.

The hotel features 40 rooms with 2 queen-size beds, of which 6 have interconnecting doors. 24 rooms can be turned to triples on request, making them ideal for families. All rooms are en suite with a shower.

The hotel offers an outdoor swimming pool with children's swimming area, safaris and entertainment with a traditional Maasai dance show every night. The Maasai are known for their high jumping movements in dance. The large public room features a fireplace and offers a pleasant atmosphere in which to unwind after a long safari day, to enjoy an evening drink or to share memorable moments with other travellers from around the world. Every afternoon, an educational presentation about the culture of the Maasai is presented by resident anthropologists.

The main restaurant, with a pretty view of Kilimanjaro, serves international and local cuisine prepared by top chefs.

250 km from Nairobi airport, approximately 4 hours drive on tarmac and murram all weather road. Flying from Nairobi is approximately 40 min and an hour's transfer time to the lodge.
